ZIDOVUDINE

NUCLEOSIDE REVERSE TRANSCRIPTASE INHIBITORS

  • Indications and doses
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Administration
  • Cautions
  • Monitoring requirements
  • Prescribing and dispensing
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

HIV infection in combination with other antiretroviral drugs,

By mouth

  • For adults
    250–300 mg twice daily.

Prevention of maternal-fetal HIV transmission,

By mouth or by intravenous infusion

  • For adults
    Seek specialist advice (combination therapy preferred) (consult local protocol).

HIV infection in combination with other antiretroviral drugs in patients temporarily unable to take zidovudine by mouth,

By intravenous infusion

  • For adults
    0.8–1 mg/kg every 4 hours usually for not more than 2 weeks, dose approximating to 1.2–1.5 mg/kg every 4 hours by mouth.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Accumulation may occur.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Reduce oral dose to 300–400 mg daily in divided doses or intravenous dose to 1 mg/kg 3–4 times daily if eGFR is less than 10 mL/minute/1.73 m2.

Contra indications

  • Acute porphyrias
  • abnormally low haemoglobin concentration (consult product literature)
  • abnormally low neutrophil counts (consult product literature)

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Anaemia (may require transfusion), anxiety, chest pain, convulsions, depression, dizziness, drowsiness, gynaecomastia, influenza-like symptoms, loss of mental acuity, myopathy, neuropathy, paraesthesia, pigmentation of nails, pigmentation of oral mucosa, pigmentation of skin, pruritus, sweating, taste disturbance, urinary frequency,

Anaemia and myelosuppression

If anaemia or myelosuppression occur, reduce dose or interrupt treatment according to product literature, or consider other treatment

Lipoatrophy

Zidovudine is associated with a higher risk of lipoatrophy than other antiretrovirals and should be used only if alternative regimens are not suitable.

Directions for administration

With intravenous use

For intermittent intravenous infusion, dilute to a concentration of 2 mg/mL or 4 mg/mL with Glucose 5% and give over 1 hour.

Cautions regarding administration

  • Elderly
  • risk of haematological toxicity particularly with high dose and advanced disease
  • vitamin B12 deficiency (increased risk of neutropenia)

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

Monitor full blood count after 4 weeks of treatment, then every 3 months.

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

The abbreviation AZT which is sometimes used for zidovudine has also been used for another drug.

Prepared medicinal forms of ZIDOVUDINE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Capsule
Oral solution
Solution for infusion
